trans-unit.source: Stores data points and series attributes.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object represents a data series and is stored in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> class.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> stores <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection> class.
It also stores attributes of the data series.
For example, a data series has a color attribute, background image attribute, background gradient attribute, and so forth.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects that belong to a series also have their own attributes.
Normally, if the same attribute is set for a data point and the series to which it belongs, the data point attribute has precedence.
A series is not necessarily plotted on a chart; it can store data point values that are used to perform a calculation from which another series is created and then plotted.
For example, Series A, which is plotted, may be the result of adding Series B and Series C data points together, though neither of these series is plotted.

In order to draw a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ChartArea%2A> property must be set to the name of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object used to plot the series.

When a series is created, it is automatically assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object named "Default", or to the first available chart area in the chart area collection if the "Default" object does not exist.
To disable the display of a series, set its <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ChartArea%2A> property to a zero-length string.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ChartType%2A> property determines the type of chart that will be used to plot this series, if it is drawn.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> class with the specified series name.
This constructor can be used to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> class.
This series is only capable of storing <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects that have one Y-value.
If a data point that has multiple Y-values is added to this series, an exception will be thrown.
To create a series at run time, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection.Add%2A> method.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that will be created.
This must be a unique name, otherwise an exception will be thrown.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> class with the specified name and maximum number of Y values.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> class.
This series will only be able to store <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects that do not have more Y-values than the maximum set by the `yValues` parameter.
If you add a data point that has more Y-values than the set maximum, an exception will be thrown.
To create a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object at run time, the `Add` and `Insert` methods of the Series collection property can also be used.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object that will be created.
The maximum number of Y-values allowed for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> objects that belong to this series.
Gets or sets the axis label text for the series.
A `string` value.
The default value is a zero-length string.
Gets or sets the name of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> object used to plot the data series, if any.

When a series is added at both design time and run time, it is automatically assigned to the "Default" <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> object, or the first available chart area in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartAreaCollection> if "Default" does not exist.
Set this property to a zero-length string if you do not want the series to be plotted.
A `string` value that represents a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> object, which is used to plot the series.
Gets or sets the chart type of a series.
This property determines the chart type of the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object; the value is case-sensitive.
See the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesChartType> enumeration for a list of all possible chart types for a series.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesChartType"></xref> enumeration value that indicates the chart type that will be used to represent the series.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesChartType.Column"></xref>.
Gets or sets the name of the chart type used to draw the series.
A `string` value that represents the name of the chart type.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets or sets the drawing style of points marked as empty.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.EmptyPointStyle%2A> property determines the drawing style of points marked as empty, for example, in the border color, in the marker images, background color or images, and so forth.
Certain properties are only applicable for specific chart types.
For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImage%2A> property does not apply to line charts, but does apply to an area chart.

To display an image that indicates an empty point, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.MarkerImage%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.MarkerStyle%2A> properties, and not the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.BackImage%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.AxisLabel%2A> property determines the axis label for empty points.

Note that for stacked chart types, the axis label is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.AxisLabel%2A> property of the first plotted series that has this property set.
Data points can be manually marked as an empty by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint.IsEmpty%2A> property to `true`.

Alternatively, one of the `InsertEmptyPoints` methods in the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator> class can be used to check for missing data and insert empty points if a data point is missing.

In the case of line-type charts, the line color for lines that connect to an empty point is determined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.Color%2A> property setting.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether the series will be visible on the rendered chart.
Gets or sets a value that determines if the series will be visible on the rendered <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea>.
`true` if the series will be visible on the rendered chart; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.
Gets or sets a flag that indicates whether data point indices will be used for the X-values.
All data points in a series use sequential indices, and if this property is `true` then data points will be plotted sequentially, regardless of their associated X-values.
This means that there will be no "missing" data points.
For example, assume there are three (3) data points in a series having X-values of 1, 2 and 4.
If this property was `false`, there would be a data point missing at the X-axis location labeled "3".
However, if you set this property to `true`, the three data points will be plotted at points 1, 2, and 4, sequentially, and there will be no missing data point.
The X-axis location labeled "3" will not appear on the chart.
This is useful when you do not want to have missing data points for intervals that you know you will not have data for, such as weekends.

If you are displaying multiple series and at least one series uses indexed X-values, then all series must be aligned—that is, have the same number of data points—and the corresponding points must have the same X-values.
`true` if the indices of data points that belong to the series will be used for X-values; `false` if they will not.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the name of the series associated with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend"></xref> object.
When a series is added at both design time and run time, it is automatically assigned to the default <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> object.

If you do not want the series shown in a legend, set this property to a zero-length string, or set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.IsVisibleInLegend%2A> property to `false`.
A `string` value that represents the name of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend"></xref> object.
Gets or sets a value that determines how often to display data point markers.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.MarkerStep%2A> property specifies the frequency with which markers are displayed.
For example, if you set this property to two (2), every other data point will use a marker.
This property is only used if markers are enabled using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.MarkerStyle%2A> property.
An `integer` value that determines how often to display data point markers.
The default value is one (1).
Gets or sets the unique name of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object.
The name of a data series must be unique; otherwise an exception will be thrown.

This property can be used as the indexer when you retrieve a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> object.
If this property is set to a zero-length string, an exception will be thrown.
A `string` value that represents the unique name of the data series.
Gets or sets the color palette of a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> object.

A palette is used to automatically assign colors to data elements if the data points themselves do not have colors assigned to them and if the data <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> object that the data points belong to also does not have an assigned color.
If no series or data point colors are explicitly specified, the colors used depend on the chart type and the Chart control palette or Series palette, if one is specified.
See the table below for further details:
Chart Type
Series Palette Used?
Colors Displayed by Data Points
Any shape chart (for example, Pie and Doughnut charts)
No
First available colors used from <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control palette.
One color per data point.
All charts except shape charts
No
First available colors from <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control palette.
One color per data series.
Any shape chart (for example, Pie and Doughnut charts)
Yes
First available colors used from <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> palette.
One color per data point.
All charts except shape charts
Yes
First available colors used from <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>palette.
One color per data series.

This <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.Palette%2A> property has precedence over the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Palette%2A> property of the root <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object, with respect to the display of data.

NOTE: If the `Palette` property for both the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects is set to None, and no color is assigned to the relevant data series/data points, the default palette "BrightPastel" or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PaletteCustomColors%2A> is used.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorPalette"></xref> enumeration value that determines the palette for the data series.
Gets a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.Points%2A> collection property allows you to add and remove data points to a series.
This property also provides methods and properties that can be used to manipulate this collection, such as finding data points, performing data-binding, and so forth.

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCollection"></xref> object that represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the shadow color of a series.
Gets or sets the shadow color of a series, which can be to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
The alpha value can be used to achieve a realistic shadow effect; try using a color value of "128,0,0,0" for shadows.
To implement a shadow, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.ShadowOffset%2A> property to a value other than zero (0).
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Black"></xref>.
Gets or sets the shadow offset, in pixels, of a series.
To implement shadowing, use a value other than zero (0).
A positive value will result in a shadow that shifts down and to the right.
A negative value will result in a shadow that shifts up and to the left.
An `integer` value that represents the shadow offset of the series, in pixels.
Gets or sets the style of the smart labels.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.SmartLabelStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
Sorts the points in the series using <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> interface.
The <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> interface.
Sorts the data points in the series, given the specified sort order.
The sort order.
Sorts the points in the series, given the specified sort order and value to use for the sort.
The sort order.
The value used for the sort (X, Y, Y2 ...).
Gets or sets the X-axis type of the series.

For all chart types except horizontally oriented charts such as bar and stacked bar charts, and shape charts such as pie, doughnut, funnel and pyramid charts, the primary X-axis is always the lower axis and the secondary axis is the upper axis.
For bar and stacked bar charts, the primary X-axis is the left axis, and the secondary X-axis is the right axis.

When data is plotted using the secondary X-axis, you must use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisX2%2A> property to set axis properties, and not the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisX%2A> property.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.XAxisType"></xref> enumeration value that determines if the series uses the primary or secondary X-axis.
Gets or sets the member column of the chart data source used to data bind to the X-value of the series.
This property accepts either the name of the member column or the ordinal value of the member column.
A `string` value.
Gets or sets the value types plotted along the X-axis.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.XValueType%2A> property determines the type of data stored by the series.
Set this property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.DateTime> to allow the X-value to be entered as a <xref:System.DateTime> value, and not as a <xref:System.Double>.
Date and time values are internally stored by .NET Framework as <xref:System.Double> values.

The same holds true for the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.ToPosition%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel.FromPosition%2A> properties of <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.CustomLabel> objects.
The `IntervalType` property found in axis label, tick mark, and grid classes determines the interval type.

To correctly apply a <xref:System.DateTime> format to axis labels that are generated from data point X-values, using the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.LabelStyle.Format%2A> property, this property must be set to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.DateTime>.
This property can also be used to determine the data type to which the X-values are bound.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType"></xref> enumeration value that determines the type of X-value data stored by the series.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.Auto"></xref>.
Gets or sets the Y-axis type of a series.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.YAxisType%2A> property determines if a series is plotted using the primary or secondary Y-axis.
For all chart types except pie, doughnut, range bar, bar and stacked bar charts, the primary Y-axis is the left vertical axis, and the secondary axis is the right vertical axis.
For bar and stacked bar charts, the primary axis is the lower horizontal axis, and the secondary Y-axis is the upper horizontal axis.

When data is plotted using the secondary Y-axis, you must use the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisY2%2A> property to set axis properties, and not the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea.AxisY%2A> property.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.AxisType"></xref> enumeration value that determines if a series uses the primary or secondary Y-axis.
Gets or sets member columns of the chart data source used to bind data to the Y-values of the series.
This property accepts a comma separated string that contains the names or ordinal values of the columns.
A `string` value.

Gets or sets the maximum number of Y-values that <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint"></xref> objects in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> are allowed to have.
If you add a <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> object that has more Y-values than this property specifies, the excess Y-values will be ignored.
The number of Y-values that are required to properly display a chart depends on the chart type selected.
An `integer` value that represents the maximum number of Y-values that the data points in a series are allowed to have.
The default value to one (1).
Gets or sets the type of Y-value data in the data points stored by a series.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.YValueType%2A> property determines the type of data stored by the series.
The value of this property is normally set to either <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.Auto> or <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.DateTime>.
The `IntervalType` property found in axis label, tick mark, and grid classes determines the interval type.
This property can also be used to determine the data type to which the Y-values are bound.
It is possible to plot date expressions as the values of data points, though this is rarely done.
If you set this property to <xref:System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.DateTime>, the Y-value can then entered as a <xref:System.DateTime> value, and not as a <xref:System.Double>.
Date and time values are internally stored by .NET Framework as <xref:System.Double> values.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType"></xref> enumeration value that determines the type of Y-value data stored by the series.
The default value is <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartValueType.Auto"></xref>.
